intro: Pseudopodospermum semicanum, commonly known as the slender podseed plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. The fruit is a dry capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
